revised_title: A Study on the Life Cycle of Trypanosoma gambiense
tldr: The author investigates the life cycle of Trypanosoma gambiense, a parasitic protozoan responsible for African sleeping sickness, in both the vertebrate host (monkeys) and the invertebrate host (Glossina flies). The study reveals the different stages of development, multiplication, and infection in the hosts, providing insights into the transmission and progression of the disease.
